descript.abstract:
The Transit Routes layer contains all fixed routes serving the Twin Cities regional metropolitan area. One shape and one corresponding record exists for each individual transit route.
The line work for the dataset was derived from MRCC Street Centerlines and NCompass Centerlines for Sherburne and Wright County areas. A small number of line segments have been added to completely depict the network traveled by fixed-route transit vehicles.
descript.purpose: To identify all locations in the Twin Cities metropolitan area where fixed-route transit routes exist.

timeperd.current: Transit Routes geography is updated weekly and includes linework from the MRCC and NCompass Street Centerline dataset.

theme.themekey: transit, buses, routes, streets, roads, transportation, Transit Routes, Bus Routes

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County, Sherburn County

idinfo.accconst: None. This dataset is public domain under the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). If the dataset is not available from the Online Linkage in Section 6, please contact the Distribution Contact Person.
idinfo.useconst: None. This dataset is public domain under the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13).

citeinfo.title: 1) MRCC Street Centerline 2) NCompass Street Centerline 3) Metro Transit - TransitPatterns, TransitRoutes, TransitStops

dataqual.logic: This dataset contains one record and one PolyLine Shape for each route in the Metro area transit system.
dataqual.complete: The routes include routes which have service information provided on Metro Transit's website.

procstep.procdesc: This dataset was created in Giro's Hastus scheduling software and referenced the MRCC and NCompass street centerline datasets. See the metadata for the MRCC and NCompass Street Centerline layer for source information.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire seven county region.

overview.eaover:
LINE ATTRIBUTES:
route: A number identifying the route number associated with the route and its schedules.
routesort: A numeric field identifying the route number associated with the route and its schedules
Routedescription (routedscrp): A brief description of the route.
routetype: A description of the type of route.
1 - Routes that provide a connecting link between urban local routes, and many times serve as suburban circulators. 2 - Routes that are radial, crosstown and limited stop services which primarily operate in the center cities. 3 - Routes that provide peak and all-day service traveling non-stop on highways for four or more miles. (THIS FIELD IS NO LONGER MAINTAINED IN SCHEDULING SOFTWARE AND WILL RETIRE BY END OF 2022).
RouteClass: a description of the route classification per the Metropolitan Council's Transportation Policy Plan (TPP).
RouteOperator (route_oper): A description of the operator of the route. 'M' values represent routes are operated by Metro Transit. 'P' values represent routes not operated by Metro Transit. 'MP' values represent routes operated by Metro Transit and another transit provider.
EffectiveDate (effectived): The pick date
payleavedirectionid (payleavedi): The direction of a route where customers are required to pay when exiting the bus rather than boarding.
routepayleave (routepayle): Routes where customers pay fare when exiting the bus rather than boarding
twelvecolor (twelvecolo): An internal code used for cartographic dispalay
*_ftrip: The first trip time served by route at the the routes first stop per service period (Weekday, Saturday, Sunday)
*_ltrip: The last trip time served by route at the routes last stop per service period (Weekday, Saturday, Sunday)
*_span: The span of service by route in hours and mintues
